title: CBR Exam Costs and Fees 2025
content: Current CBR exam costs: Theory exam €48.75 (increase from €48.00), Practical test car (B) €89.00, Motorcycle test €99.00, Truck test €179.00. Additional costs: English language surcharge €6.25, Evening/weekend surcharge €6.00. Retake fees same as original exam costs.

title: How to Book CBR Exams
content: Book theory and practical exams online at cbr.nl/mijn-cbr. Requirements: Valid DigiD, theory exam must be passed before booking practical test. Payment via iDEAL or credit card. Cancel/reschedule up to 5 working days before exam without penalty. Emergency cancellation possible with medical certificate.

title: CBR Theory Exam Comprehensive Guide
content: Theory exam consists of 65 multiple choice questions, 44 correct answers required to pass (67.7%). Exam duration: 30 minutes for most categories. Available languages: Dutch, English, German, Turkish, Arabic. Topics covered: traffic rules, road signs, hazard perception, environmental awareness. Pass rate approximately 45-50%. Valid for 18 months after passing.

title: CBR Practical Driving Test Format
content: Practical test duration: 35 minutes for car (B), 40 minutes for motorcycle. Test includes: general driving skills, special maneuvers (parallel parking, 3-point turn, emergency braking), independent driving (following directions or GPS). Assessment criteria: control of vehicle, observation, positioning, communication with other road users. Pass rate varies by location (60-75%).

title: Dutch Driving License Validity and Renewal
content: Dutch driving licenses valid for 10 years (issued after 2013). Renewal required before expiry date. EU licenses accepted for visitors up to 185 days. Non-EU licenses: exchange possible within 185 days of residency. Medical examination required for certain categories and after age 75. Digital driving license available via RDW app.
